title: Trial by Algorithm
outcome: Facing collapse, a citywide 'public trial' exposes hidden BCI abuses and Council cover-ups. Council leaders are judged in full view, and Halden’s secret message shows how he orchestrated his death to force transparency. A reckoning follows, forcing the end of BCI authoritarianism.

events.description: A citizens’ commission announces a live 'BCI trial' for senior Council members. Rada broadcasts details of the trial process, igniting intense public interest.
Testimonies reveal BCI abuses: unfair scoring, data manipulation, and disappearances. Lintz admits to emergency actions that worsened score disparities after Halden’s death.
During the trial, a final encrypted message from Halden is revealed: 'Transparency is not a guarantee of justice, but it is a beginning.' Citywide debate over the meaning ensues.
The public votes to end centralized BCI scoring and strip the Council of formal authority. News of Council members seeking asylum in other districts spreads quickly.
A new era starts as the city disbands the Council, distributing power to neighborhoods. Rada’s coverage of this turning point cements Halden’s legacy as an architect of transformation.
